entry.title: Metagait uses virtual reality and other devices to rehabilitate Armenian soldiers

media:group.media:title: Metagait uses virtual reality and other devices to rehabilitate Armenian soldiers
media:group.media:description:
Seyran Soghoyan participated in the Second Karabakh War. On October 5, a bullet damaged his spine, rendering him paralyzed in his legs. Seyran has been using a Metagait device so that he can feel his feet again and walk. The device was created by the Qayltech team. CivilNet‚Äôs team visited Seyran to gain insight into Metagait and how it helps soldiers going through rehabilitation.

entry.title: Russian deputy prime minister discusses opening regional transport links in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Russian deputy prime minister discusses opening regional transport links in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan took part in a sitting of the Commonwealth of Independent States council of foreign ministers in Tajikistan. The organization is a supranational body consisting of former Soviet states. üìçPrime Minister Nikol Pashinyan received Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexei Overchuk and Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Andrei Rudenko to discuss opening regional transport links. üìçPashinyan appointed Arkady Peleshyan, a local politician with a dubious criminal past, as Vanadzor‚Äôs new acting mayor.

entry.title: As Lebanon votes, Armenians consider political choices

media:group.media:title: As Lebanon votes, Armenians consider political choices
media:group.media:description:
On May 15, Lebanon will head to the polls to elect a new parliament and government. The country, reeling from the devastating 2020 blast in Beirut, a severe financial crisis and ongoing street protests, is largely split along sectarian lines. Ara Sanjian, an Associate Professor at the University of Michigan-Dearborn, talks to CivilNet about these crucial elections and how Lebanon‚Äôs large Armenian constituency fits into the country‚Äôs political system.

entry.title: Armenia: A failed government and a failed opposition

media:group.media:title: Armenia: A failed government and a failed opposition
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of Insights With Eric Hacopian, Eric discusses the ongoing anti-government protests in Yerevan, and what his message would be to both the protest leaders and the government. Eric also talks about a campaign by Russians who have moved to Armenia to clean up litter across the country.

entry.title: Blinken calls on Azerbaijan to release Armenian POWs

media:group.media:title: Blinken calls on Azerbaijan to release Armenian POWs
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe foreign ministers of Armenia, Azerbaijan and Russia meet in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. üìçArmenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan held talks with Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte. üìçUS Secretary of State Anthony Blinken called on Azerbaijan to release all remaining Armenian POWs.
